message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.LG 

This paper investigates the birth and diffusion of lexical innovations in online social communities, which falls under the scope of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The study also uses sociolinguistic theories to analyze the social role of individuals who use the novel terms, which could be categorized under social and information sciences (cs.SI) and systems and control (cs.SD). The paper also focuses on predicting the success of linguistic innovations, which could be related to machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the study analyzes the characteristics of innovators and adopters, which could be categorized under social and information sciences (cs.SOC).
